title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces.

title: As winds pick up, LA firefighters desperately battle to contain monster inferno
byline: Firefighters are making an all-out assault to prevent the largest of the deadly wildfires that is threatening Los Angeles from spreading into one of the city’s most exclusive neighbourhoods.

title: Registration mandatory for mill owners purchasing paddy
byline: Deputy Minister of Trade, Commerce, and Food Security, R.M. Jayawardena, says that all mill owners and storekeepers who purchase paddy during the ‘Maha season’ are required to register with the government’s Paddy Marketing Board.

title: Warning issued over strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for the sea areas off the coasts extending from Colombo to Kankasanthurai via Puttalam.

title: Sluice gates of Ratkinda reservoir opened, roads submerged
byline: Four more sluice gates of the Ratkinda reservoir have been opened following heavy rainfall this morning (12).

title: Earthslip disrupts train services in up-country line
byline:
Update 11.25 a.m.:
The train operations along the upcountry railway line which were disrupted following an earthslip between the Ohiya and Idalgasinna railway stations, have now been restored after the tracks were cleared, according to the Department of Railways.

title: Dozens injured after France tram collision
byline: At least 30 people have been injured after two trams collided at Strasbourg’s central station on Saturday, authorities said.

title: Govt. to ease barriers for green energy products, support AI innovation
byline: Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunnetti says that the government will take measures to introduce a range of environmentally friendly products rooted in green energy principles, while preserving local identity, within the next two years.

title: Sri Lanka’s remarkable tourism growth in 2024, greater sights on 2025
byline: Sri Lanka has emerged as a shining star in global tourism, recording an impressive $3.17 billion in revenue in 2024. The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) reports this as a 53.2% leap from the $2.07 billion earned in 2023, reaffirming the island’s growing allure as a must-visit destination.

title: Four new Supreme Court Justices sworn in
byline: Four newly appointed Supreme Court Justices have taken their oaths of office before President Anura Kumara Disanayake this morning (12) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Taxes on vehicles may increase up to 600%: Vehicle importers
byline: The Sri Lanka Vehicle Importers’ Association has raised concerns about the potential hike in vehicle import taxes, which are currently at approximately 300%. According to the association, taxes could climb to 400%, 500%, or even 600% for certain vehicles.

title: 8 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A special operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy has led to the seizure of two Indian fishing boats and the apprehension of 08 Indian fishermen, poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Tamarind shortage in market; Prices skyrocket ahead of Thai Pongal
byline: The price of tamarind has been rapidly rising due to a shortage in the local market.

title: Disney commits $15 million to help Los Angeles area rebuild from destructive wildfires
byline: The Walt Disney Company committed $15 million to help with response and rebuilding efforts for the deadly wildfires that have scorched the Los Angeles area this week.

title: New research shows a quarter of freshwater animals are threatened with extinction
byline: Nearly a quarter of animals living in rivers, lakes and other freshwater sources are threatened with extinction, according to new research published Wednesday.

title: No further extensions for returning licensed firearms provided to civilians: Defense Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Defense has reiterated that the deadline for returning for inspection the licensed firearms issued for personal use will not be extended beyond January 20, 2025 under any circumstances.

title: Jeju Air black box data missing from crucial minutes before crash, South Korea ministry says
byline: The two black boxes on the Boeing jet involved in the worst aviation disaster on South Korean soil stopped recording about four minutes before the accident, the transport ministry said on Saturday.

title: Hollywood celebrities clear their closets for fire aid
byline: When wildfires destroyed parts of Los Angeles this week, real estate agent Jenna Cooper started asking friends for clothing and other items to help people in need.

title: New excise duty rates announced for vehicle imports
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has announced new excise duty rates for vehicle imports, effective immediately, in a special gazette notification issued today (11).

title: China ready to deepen political trust and strengthen ties during President Dissanayake’s visit
byline: At the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping, Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will pay a state visit to China from Jan. 14 to 17, Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson Hua Chunying announced during a press conference held in China on Friday (10).

title: Sri Lankan cricketer Dhananjaya de Silva’s brother remanded
byline: Savithra de Silva, also known as “Sangu,” the brother of Sri Lanka’s Test cricket captain Dhananjaya de Silva, has been ordered to be remanded in custody until January 24, 2025, after he was produced before Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court.

title: Sri Lankan workers remit over USD 6.57 bln in 2024
byline: Sri Lankans working in other countries remitted over 6.57 billion U.S. dollars in 2024, which is a 10.1 percent increase compared to 2023, the latest data by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka showed.

title: Doctors’ union alleges SPC tender awarded to blacklisted company
byline: The Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance for Medical and Civil Rights has alleged misconduct by the State Pharmaceuticals Corporation (SPC), accusing it of awarding a tender to a blacklisted Bangladeshi company for the supply of disinfectant used to clean patients’ mouths.

title: What ignited the deadly California wildfires?
byline: Investigators are considering an array of possible ignition sources for the huge fires that have killed at least 11 people and destroyed thousands of homes and businesses in the Los Angeles area.

title: Schoolgirl in uniform kidnapped in Daulagala
byline: Police have launched an investigation into the abduction of a schoolgirl, an incident that has been widely circulated on social media.

title: More details revealed on abduction of schoolgirl in Daulagala
byline: Police investigations into the abduction of a schoolgirl in Daulagala, Kandy, have revealed that the primary suspect is a close relative—the son of the girl’s father’s sister.
